title: Explore Your R Libraries
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(tofilibminer2) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: Provides a brief summary of the package libraries on your machine — lib_summary
text: data.frame containing count packages user's libraries. lib_size column included sizes = TRUE.

title: Provides a brief summary of the package libraries on your machine — lib_summary
code: lib_summary() #>                           Library n_packages #> 1 /home/runner/work/_temp/Library         66 #> 2      /opt/R/4.4.0/lib/R/library         29 #> 3 /opt/R/4.4.0/lib/R/site-library          1 lib_summary(sizes = TRUE) #>                           Library n_packages lib_size #> 1 /home/runner/work/_temp/Library         66 66075972 #> 2      /opt/R/4.4.0/lib/R/library         29 75732206 #> 3 /opt/R/4.4.0/lib/R/site-library          1 14406443
